issue.title: Is there anyone train successfullly on this repo?

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
I had made many kinds of attempts to train on my own dataset , but failed at last.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43720092/52937663-bd92b780-339a-11e9-8cb3-1e653ca6ea42.png)
And finally my model cannot detect anything except empty boxes......
I had checked every step I had taken , and reading this code carefully enough,but nothing seems to work!
Anyone who had train successfully please contact me ,thanks!!
email:  mq_chaser@126.com
qq: 1343545543

body: Thanks a lot !! I'm grateful for your explaining!!

@glenn-jocher This might sound stupid, but have You tested this on GPU?

Without modifying anything in the current version, I've got `Expected object of backend CUDA but got backend CPU for argument #2` errors at multiple places, ex.:
```
in utils/utils.py line 242: inter_area = torch.min(box1, box2).prod(2)
in train.py line 129: loss = model(imgs.to(device), targets, var=var)
```
Seems like one of the parameters been initialized with .cuda() while some others were not. Is this a bug or am I doing something not properly?

@tamasbalassa yes you are correct! I've fixed this error, so training works on either GPU or CPU now. You can optionally force CPU usage here:
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/a65a383d3a81dd56a31271936cc8045dfbb4d645/utils/torch_utils.py#L11

For one image training, this 

`n_burnin = min(round(dataloader.nB / 5), 1000)`
evaluates to 0 and 

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 205, in <module>
    var=opt.var,
  File "train.py", line 124, in train
    lr = lr0 * (i / n_burnin) ** 4
ZeroDivisionError: division by zero
```

@bogdan42k yes good catch, you are right! I've tweaked the code now so `n_burning` should be at least 1.
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/ff9d34301934b17f0c5b3589a684068b3db15bef/train.py#L90

@glenn-jocher 
thanks for your great work!
when i train only one image according to yout tutorials.
it happens :
`Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 210, in <module>
    var=opt.var,
  File "train.py", line 157, in train
    loss_per_target = rloss['loss'] /rloss['nT']
ZeroDivisionError: float division by zero`
what should i do to slove this problem?  the version of my python is 3.5
@depth-perception yes you are correct, I see the same error. I've updated the repo to correct this, try again with a git clone of the latest.

@glenn-jocher
thanks for your solution!
i have found some errors.
the first is also happened in one image training tutorials.
which is as follows:
`Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 208, in <module> var=opt.var, File "train.py", line 180, in train file.write(s + '%11.3g' * 3 % (mAP, P, R) + '\n') UnboundLocalError: local variable 's' referenced before assignment`

the second errors happens when i run test.py by use of the yolov3.weights, 
which is as follows:
```
Namespace(batch_size=16, cfg='cfg/yolov3.cfg', conf_thres=0.3, data_cfg='cfg/coco.data', img_size=416, iou_thres=0.5, nms_thres=0.45, save_json=False, weights='weights/yolov3.weights')

Using cuda _CudaDeviceProperties(name='GeForce GTX 1060', major=6, minor=1, total_memory=6078MB, multi_processor_count=10)

      Image      Total          P          R        mAP
         16       5000          0          0          0      0.575s
         32       5000          0          0          0      0.405s
         48       5000          0          0          0      0.407s
         64       5000          0          0          0      0.409s
         80       5000          0          0          0      0.428s
         96       5000          0          0          0      0.405s
        112       5000          0          0          0      0.409s
        128       5000          0          0          0      0.427s
        144       5000          0          0          0      0.419s
        160       5000          0          0          0      0.418s
        176       5000          0          0          0      0.413s
        192       5000          0          0          0      0.414s
        208       5000          0          0          0       0.42s
        224       5000          0          0          0      0.417s
        240       5000          0          0          0      0.426s
        256       5000          0          0          0      0.409s
        272       5000          0          0          0      0.398s
        288       5000          0          0          0      0.436s
        304       5000          0          0          0      0.428s
        320       5000          0          0          0      0.436s
        336       5000          0          0          0      0.406s
        352       5000          0          0          0      0.408s
        368       5000          0          0          0      0.423s
        384       5000          0          0          0      0.419s
```

@depth-perception the single-image and single-class tutorials are both operating as expected. `test.py` functions as expected under default conditions. Download the latest repo, and decrease your batch_size if your GPU is running out of RAM.
```
Namespace(batch_size=32, cfg='cfg/yolov3.cfg', conf_thres=0.3, data_cfg='cfg/coco.data', img_size=416, iou_thres=0.5, nms_thres=0.45, save_json=False, weights='weights/yolov3.weights')

Using cpu 

      Image      Total          P          R        mAP
         32       5000      0.633      0.579      0.569       44.1s
         64       5000      0.625      0.584      0.574       43.5s
         96       5000      0.655      0.625      0.616       40.2s
```
